Lebanon, militants battle for a 3rd day





Black plumes of smoke poured from a Palestinian refugee camp near Tripoli on
Tuesday as members of an Islamic militant group battled the Lebanese army for
a third day.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















U.S.: Poppy profits fuel Taliban





Profits from Afghanistan's thriving poppy fields are increasingly flowing to
Taliban fighters, leading U.S. and NATO officials to conclude that the
counterinsurgency mission must now include stepped-up anti-drug efforts.

Church gunman promised suicide and murder, police say





A gunman suspected of killing three people and himself said during a
court-ordered mental evaluation that if he committed suicide, he would try to
take a large number of people with him, police said Monday.





FULL STORY
















Wayward whales take another wrong turn





The journey of a wayward whale and her calf back to the Pacific Ocean hit a
snag Monday when the pair reversed course and began heading back up the
Sacramento River.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Hit man with conscience thwarts plan to kill family





A man tried to hire a hit man to kill his family, including his 7-year-old
daughter, even requesting that she be shot in the chest and not the head so
there could be an open casket at her funeral, authorities say.





FULL STORY
















Man accused of starving cocker spaniel 





A man was accused of starving his 3-year-old cocker spaniel nearly to death
and then taking the dog to an animal shelter and saying it wasn't his.





FULL STORY

Iraq plans for possible quick U.S. pullout





Iraq's military is drawing up plans to cope with any quick U.S. military
pullout, the defense minister said, as a senior American official warned that
the Bush administration may reconsider its support if Iraqi leaders do not
make major reforms by fall.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Police ask for missing girl photos





Tourists who stayed at the Portuguese resort where four -year-old Madeleine
McCann was abducted were urged on Monday to hand over any holiday photographs
which might contain clues to the British child's kidnapper.





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Dead whales used in dramatic demo





As part of a dramatic protest against commercial whaling, Greenpeace activists
laid the carcasses of 17 small whales and dolphins in front of the landmark
Brandenburg Gate.





FULL STORY
















Suspected Taliban ambush kills 25 insurgents





Suspected Taliban ambushed a U.S.-led coalition and Afghan patrol in the
volatile south, sparking a battle and airstrikes that killed 25 insurgents,
officials said Monday.

My big fat American gas tax





It seems completely counterintuitive: Raise the gasoline tax to help American

Backlash against RFID is growing





Civil rights and privacy rights groups have opposed radio frequency
identification, or RFID, for years. But now, researchers in the field and some
lawmakers are beginning to voice concerns about the security of the
technology.

John Donovan: MLB Power Rankings





The first, brief act of interleague play is done, with sweeps by the Tigers
(over the hapless Cardinals) and the Angels (over the punchless Dodgers)
giving the American League a slight edge over its National League punching
bags. For those of you keeping track of these types of things at home, that
is.

Report: Adelman will soon be named Rockets' coach





Former Kings and Trail Blazers coach Rick Adelman was expected to be in
Houston on Tuesday, and local media were reporting he'd be the next head coach
of the Rockets.

Swim classes aren't just for kids





Blowing bubbles in the water is fun when you're a child, but for Stacey
Mueller, it's part of a bigger endeavor. At the age of 45, she is learning how
to swim. "It's very hard," says Mueller. "It's like learning a language or
learning how to breathe when you're young."





FULL STORY
      WATCH VIDEO
















Vitamin use may be linked to advanced prostate cancer





There's more worrisome news about vitamins: Taking too many may increase men's
risk of dying from prostate cancer.

MySpace will turn over names of sex offenders





MySpace.com will provide a number of state attorneys general with data on
registered sex offenders who use the popular social networking Web site, the
company said Monday.





FULL STORY
















Microsoft-Vietnam cement anti-piracy deal





Microsoft Corp. CEO Steve Ballmer witnessed the signing of an agreement Monday
requiring all of Vietnam's government offices to use licensed computer
software in a step to curb rampant piracy.

Legendary actress still a special voice





Julie Andrews has been Hollywood royalty for decades. Lately, she's had the
parts to prove it with queenly roles in "The Princess Diaries" and "Shrek"
films.





FULL STORY
















'Prison Break' actor pleads guilty





Actor Lane Garrison, who played an inmate on the TV drama "Prison Break,"
pleaded guilty Monday to vehicular manslaughter and drunken driving for a car
crash in December that killed a 17-year-old student.
